verses.kjv: On that night could not the king sleep, and he commanded to bring the book of records of the chronicles; and they were read before the king.
verses.ct: That night, the king couldn't sleep. He ordered that the official record books of the kingdom's history be brought in and read to him.

verses.kjv: And it was found written, that Mordecai had told of Bigthana and Teresh, two of the king’s chamberlains, the keepers of the door, who sought to lay hand on the king Ahasuerus.
verses.ct: In the records, they found the account of how Mordecai had reported the plot of Bigthana and Teresh, 2 of the king's officials who guarded the entrance and had conspired to assassinate King Ahasuerus.

verses.kjv: And the king said, What honour and dignity hath been done to Mordecai for this? Then said the king’s servants that ministered unto him, There is nothing done for him.
verses.ct: The king asked, "What recognition or reward was given to Mordecai for this?" His attendants who were serving him replied, "Nothing has been done for him."

verses.kjv: And the king said, Who is in the court? Now Haman was come into the outward court of the king’s house, to speak unto the king to hang Mordecai on the gallows that he had prepared for him.
verses.ct: The king asked, "Who is out in the courtyard?" Now Haman had just arrived in the outer courtyard of the palace to ask the king about hanging Mordecai on the pole he had set up for him.

verses.kjv: And the king’s servants said unto him, Behold, Haman standeth in the court. And the king said, Let him come in.
verses.ct: The king's attendants told him, "Look, Haman is standing in the courtyard." The king said, "Bring him in."

verses.kjv: So Haman came in. And the king said unto him, What shall be done unto the man whom the king delighteth to honour? Now Haman thought in his heart, To whom would the king delight to do honour more than to myself?
verses.ct: So Haman entered. The king asked him, "What should be done for a man the king truly wants to honor?" Haman thought to himself, "Who would the king want to honor more than me?"

verses.kjv: And Haman answered the king, For the man whom the king delighteth to honour,
verses.ct: So Haman told the king, "For the man the king truly wants to honor,

verses.kjv: Let the royal apparel be brought which the king useth to wear, and the horse that the king rideth upon, and the crown royal which is set upon his head:
verses.ct: have them bring out a royal robe that the king himself has worn, along with a horse the king himself has ridden, with a royal crown placed on its head.

verses.kjv: And let this apparel and horse be delivered to the hand of one of the king’s most noble princes, that they may array the man withal whom the king delighteth to honour, and bring him on horseback through the street of the city, and proclaim before him, Thus shall it be done to the man whom the king delighteth to honour.
verses.ct: Then hand the robe and horse over to one of the king's highest-ranking officials. Have him dress the man the king wants to honor, lead him on horseback through the city square, and announce ahead of him: 'This is what is done for the man the king truly wants to honor!'"

verses.kjv: Then the king said to Haman, Make haste, and take the apparel and the horse, as thou hast said, and do even so to Mordecai the Jew, that sitteth at the king’s gate: let nothing fail of all that thou hast spoken.
verses.ct: The king told Haman, "Hurry! Take the robe and the horse exactly as you described, and do all of this for Mordecai the Jew who sits at the king's gate. Don't leave out a single detail of what you suggested."

verses.kjv: Then took Haman the apparel and the horse, and arrayed Mordecai, and brought him on horseback through the street of the city, and proclaimed before him, Thus shall it be done unto the man whom the king delighteth to honour.
verses.ct: So Haman took the robe and the horse, dressed Mordecai, and led him on horseback through the city square, announcing ahead of him, "This is what is done for the man the king truly wants to honor!"

verses.kjv: And Mordecai came again to the king’s gate. But Haman hasted to his house mourning, and having his head covered.
verses.ct: Afterward, Mordecai returned to the king's gate. But Haman rushed home in grief, covering his head in shame.

verses.kjv: And Haman told Zeresh his wife and all his friends every thing that had befallen him. Then said his wise men and Zeresh his wife unto him, If Mordecai be of the seed of the Jews, before whom thou hast begun to fall, thou shalt not prevail against him, but shalt surely fall before him.
verses.ct: Haman told his wife Zeresh and all his friends everything that had happened to him. His advisors and his wife Zeresh said to him, "If Mordecai, the one you've started to lose ground against, is of Jewish descent, you won't be able to overcome him. You will certainly be ruined by him."

verses.kjv: And while they were yet talking with him, came the king’s chamberlains, and hasted to bring Haman unto the banquet that Esther had prepared.
verses.ct: While they were still talking with him, the king's officials arrived and quickly escorted Haman to the banquet that Esther had prepared.
